  1. #-*- coding: utf-8 -*-
  2. import os
  3. import stat
  4. from django.http import Http404, HttpResponse, HttpResponseNotModified
  5. from django.utils.http import http_date
  6. from django.views.static import was_modified_since
  7. from filer.server.backends.base import ServerBase
  10. class DefaultServer(ServerBase):
  11. """
  12. Serve static files from the local filesystem through django.
  13. This is a bad idea for most situations other than testing.
  15. This will only work for files that can be accessed in the local filesystem.
  16. """
  17. def serve(self, request, file_obj, **kwargs):
  18. fullpath = file_obj.path
  19. # the following code is largely borrowed from `django.views.static.serve`
  20. # and django-filetransfers: filetransfers.backends.default
  21. if not os.path.exists(fullpath):
  22. raise Http404('"%s" does not exist' % fullpath)
  23. # Respect the If-Modified-Since header.
  24. statobj = os.stat(fullpath)
  25. mimetype = self.get_mimetype(fullpath)
  26. if not was_modified_since(request.META.get('HTTP_IF_MODIFIED_SINCE'),
  27. statobj[stat.ST_MTIME], statobj[stat.ST_SIZE]):
  28. return HttpResponseNotModified(mimetype=mimetype)
  29. response = HttpResponse(open(fullpath, 'rb').read(), mimetype=mimetype)
  30. response["Last-Modified"] = http_date(statobj[stat.ST_MTIME])
  31. self.default_headers(request=request, response=response, file_obj=file_obj, **kwargs)
  32. return response
